content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is the function `extract_julia_code` in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    code_blocks = String[]
    in_code_block = false
    code_block_started = false
    current_code_block = ""

    for char in md
        if !in_code_block
            if char == '`' && !code_block_started
                code_block_started = true
            elseif char == '`' && code_block_started
                in_code_block = true
                code_block_started = false
            end
        else
            if char == '\n'
                push!(code_blocks, chomp(current_code_block))
                current_code_block = ""
            else
                current_code_block *= char
            end

            if char == '`'
                in_code_block = false
            end
        end
    end

    # Add the last code block if it was not empty
    !isempty(current_code_block) && push!(code_blocks, chomp(current_code_block))

    # Filter out non-Julia code blocks and join them with a newline
    julia_code_blocks = filter(block -> startswith(block, "```julia"), code_blocks)
    return join(map(chomp, julia_code_blocks), "\n")
end
```

This function takes a markdown string as input and returns a single string containing all the Julia code blocks. The function first iterates through the input string and extracts all the code blocks. Then it filters out the non-Julia code blocks and joins the remaining Julia code blocks with a newline character.
